headline: Savory Toasted Pumpkin Seeds
description: Pumpkin seeds that are crunchy and full of fall flavor. Very popular.
name: Savory Toasted Pumpkin Seeds

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Rinse the pumpkin seeds and pat dry. Place them in a bowl. Add the Worcestershire sauce, melted butter and seasoned salt; stir until evenly coated. Spread out in an even layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for about 1 hour in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until crisp, dry and golden brown.

review.reviewBody: We made these exactly lik the recipe said and they came out perfect!!
I loved it, they were the best pumpkin seeds ever!
Delicious. Added some additional spices because we did not have seasoned salt.
Loved these exactly as the recipe showed. Yum!
The best pumpkin seeds I’ve ever made! I didn’t soak them overnight but they did take a little longer to cook and dry out than the recipe said. They were perfect!!

I didn’t like the smell of the Worcestershire sauce while roasting so I expected to not like the finished product. But shortly thereafter I can’t keep my hands off of them. So good. 

Sidenote: I got some lemon essential oil on my hands a little later when i took a handful of the seeds. I think I would actually love to try this recipe with the slightest hint of lemon.
Followed the recipe. Be careful not to over bake them. Easy to add or subtract. Lots of possible variations!!!
These turned out great!! Not too salty or chewy, perfect!
Made these tonight! So tasty!!
Easy and fun to do kids!!!
Really good. Nothing more to say!
Amazing Flavor! We just added a little garlic salt which made it even better. It’s simple and quick!
Tasted like Chex mix. Really good.
AMAZING! These came out fantastic! I used a sheet of parchment paper and an avocado/olive oil blend along with Penzey's Smokey 4S. Most delicious pumpkin seeds I've ever made.
Make these every year from Halloween carved pumpkins. We love them!

I love this simple recipe! These are just like my mom used to make them, and maybe that's why I only made one small alteration. I reduced the salt to 1 t, just because of personal preference. The flavor is fine with that extra 1/4 t, and my 5 year-old ate them that way with lots of "mmm", "yum", and "these are SO good!". She's is a picky eater too! I stirred halfway through the bake time, just because I wasn't going to take the time to make sure all of the seeds were single layer. I have this recipe saved, and I will definitely be using it in the future!

These were so delicious. This was my first time making roasted pumpkin seeds. I soaked them in hot water for 25 minutes then laid them out to dry overnight. I made the mixture as written (except I used table salt). I baked for 25 minutes, stirred and then cooked them for another 15 minutes. They were golden and delicious.
My favorite recipe for pumpkin seeds so far! I made sure the seeds were mostly dry before mixing all the ingredients together. I also used "French Fry Seasoning" as the seasoning salt.
very good!
Great way to make the yearly batch of pumpkin seeds.
I used slightly less Worcestershire sauce because it isn't my favorite flavor and they are very tasty.

This turned out great. I did not follow the recipe exactly - I did not measure out the ingredients. I also used seasoned salt on the recipe.

My family loved it. I can only eat so many before I get sick of them. Best recipe I've used. I recommend!
These tasted delicious just the way the recipe said. I might have left them in just a little longer to be sure that they were a bit more crunchy, but all in all, they were a perfect snack!

Made this last night using some of the reviewers tips: I brined the seeds for 10 mins (boiled in very salty water) and let it sit in the brine for 10 mins after. I patted the seeds dry and immediately put them in the mixture. I use 1/4 tsp garlic powder and 1 tbsp salt since I didn't have seasoned salt. I baked it for 1 hr at 275°as someone else suggested to account for the wet seeds. it is fabulous!!
Added garlic powder... should have added more season salt. Very good!
Used olive oil, salt and pepper and family loved it
Easy and very tasty!
Very good, made as directed.

Oh my Gosh, love this. I followed the comments and was very pleased. Soak your seeds in salt water overnight, add a splash of soy to the butter, half garlic salt half sea salt, and I just added a few red pepper flakes to the butter but not too much. I also set a timer every 20 minutes to stir while baking. I will make this again
turned out perfect easy recipe great taste original flavor.
We all loved these!
Perfect flavor! Not too salty, not too plain; Just right!
H
THE BEST EVER PUMPKIN SEEDS! We devoured them! No changes needed.
These were great!
I followed the recipe exactly and it wasn't at all enjoyable. It's very rich and the flavour is overwhelming.
My family will be buying really big pumpkins from here on out. This the best recipe for toasted pumpkin seeds I have ever had. Thank you.
Good but I think it takes a little longer than suggested.
Good but I think it takes a little longer than suggested.
A little garlic salt makes this a tasty treat that keeps the vampires away!

I doubled the seasoning because my family loves super salty. The Worcester Sauce adds some nice flavor. Will add this recipe to my sweet-honey pumpkin seed recipe. I like to have both options every year.
Delicious and simple. I had 3 cups of pumpkin seeds so I did 1 1/2 the recipe. Because I didn't have any seasoned salt, I used a combination of garlic powder, onion powder & paprika to replace it.
I am wondering if I can find pumpkins year 'round since I can't imagine going without these amazing pumpkin seeds for three seasons a year! Best snack ever! Thank you for this recipe!
For years I only used regular salt and then roasted my pumpkin seeds which was okay. I thought I would try something different and I found this recipe. Yum! This will now be my go to.
This was my first time trying pumpkin seeds. I felt like this was a lot of work for nothing spectacular.
These were excellent! Wish l had more seeds! l added a pinch of garlic powder.
I followed recipe, but I added 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon of Cajun seasoning, and 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
I loved it! Best pumpkin seed recipe there is!
My husband says these are the best pumpkin seeds he has ever had
My favorite pumpkin seed recipe so far! I used garlic salt instead of seasoning salt. These didn't last in our house
Made 2 batches, one with Worcestershire sauce and one without. Both were very good but the ones with it reminded me of chex mix. Mine took a lot longer in the oven though.

These are delicious! I used a slightly different recipe though. I did not clean or rinse the seeds. And I used kosher salt instead of season salt. Then I cooked for 2 hours at the same temperature. Turned out perfect!

growing up on my aunts ranch,i remember making pumpkin,squash,sunflower seeds seasoned with chile&lime that was something we children looked forward to,your recipe triggered off some great memories thankyou,ALICIA

Very good! I was skeptical about the Worcestershire sauce, but it really does give it a good flavor without being over powering. Like others, I added a bit of garlic salt, and brined the seeds for about 10 min before. These turned out yummy! Will definitely do again.
I thought these were delicious!! I followed receipe but added a little garlic salt too. They were gone in an hour!! The whole family gobbled em up! ??.

I followed the reviewer who boiled in brine then soaked in marinade for 45 min. But they definitely did not take a full hour to roast!! I had at 275 deg for 25 min and they were boarderline burned. Maybe my seeds were smaller, I don't know. The flavor was good though. So next time everything the same except bake at 250 and watch closely after 20 min.

My grandchildren and I made these from the pumpkins they grew in our garden and carved for Halloween. This recipe had us all fighting over the seeds! They were delicious. We will have to grow more pumpkins next year so we will have more seeds:)

This is a great recipe! We had a lot of pumpkin seeds this fall, so I wanted a simple recipe to roast them. I did make a few changes to the recipe however. I let the seed soak overnight in salt water and then boiled them in that water for about 15 minutes. I also did not use Worcesteshire sauce on them. The seeds turned out awesome and are very crispy!
This is a great recipe! Everytime I pass by the bowl of seeds I have to take a few! Yummy!
Tastes awesome.
Deliciously crunchy and full of flavour. I wouldn't change a thing about this recipe, they turned out perfectly. Don't pay attention to the few negative reviews, this recipe is fabulous!
Easy, tasty, followed the recipe exactly except mine needed almost 90 minutes to have that nice crunch!
I cannot stop eating these! I thought it might last a bit strange with the Worcestershire sauce, but it was amazing. I followed the recipe exactly and so glad I did. Great!

MY family loved this recipe! I couldn't keep them in the bowl. I did add cayenne pepper to the butter as it melted, used garlic salt in place of the regular salt, and also boiled the seeds for 10 min. before coating them with the seasoning.

Had to adjust the recipe for a half cup or so of hubbard squash seeds. First I mixed 1 T sugar, a couple pinches of kosher salt and 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice and set aside. Then I used an 8" cast iron frying pan on the stovetop (seemed a waste to heat up the oven for such a small amount) and toasted the seeds. When they looked golden brown, I tossed in 1 T of butter which melted fast in the hot pan, then quickly sprinkled the sugar/salt/spice mix and stirred to coat all the seeds. When they were all coated, I emptied them onto a plate and spread them out to cool. By "cool" I mean still warm but not hot enough to burn my tongue! OMG delicious! I plan to try it this way again with a larger cast iron pan and pumpkin seeds and will spread them out on a cookie sheet to cool so they don't clump.
I added oregano, olive oil and season salt. In the oven for one hour at 350.
Used sesame oil instead of butter. Added some roasted garlic powder too. Had to cook the seeds longer than called for, but golden brown is a nice rule of thumb. Terrific!
I added a bit of soy sauce, Lawry's salt and garlic salt
Two thumbs up for simplicity, five stars for success!
Very good if you are looking for a different recipe. My kids even loved these!
We loved it!
So good .. Dan made many variations with liquid smoke (so good), cayenne pepper, and a variety of other spices. Always turned out good.
really did not get much Worsh sauce flavor...
This is so far, the best pumpkin seed recipe I have tried! Salty and full of flavor! Perfect for a Halloween snack!
Boiled half in salt water and didn't for the other. Didn't think there was that much difference.
Made no changes other than almost tripling the recipe - we had a lot of seeds this year! Great recipe that I'll be using every fall from now on.
Yummy

I've never made roasted pumpkin seeds before so I have nothing to compare my creation to. I did soak my seeds in salt water overnight and then followed the recipe as written. They were very tasty, although I probably soaked them too long as they were also very salty. I'll use this recipe again.
These were pretty good. I think best the first few days, after that they seemed to get old to me but this was the first time I've made pumpkin seeds.
I loved this! Couldn't convince my kids but that just means more for me!
These seeds were AMAZING! I did boil mine beforehand.....and I let them soak in the ingredients for an hour like someone else suggested. Delicious!
Pretty good! I had about 2 1/4 cups pumpkin seeds and used 2 tbsp. butter. Could use a little more salt, but still very easy and a good snack!
Just toasted some last night, they turned out well.

Easy, delicious, uses ingredients I always have on hand anyway. The perfect recipe! I only soaked in salt water for 15 minutes because the kids were dying to eat some before bed and they were still wonderful.
i didn't rinse the seeds, and they turned out delicious!
The family loved these pumpkin seeds! The only substitute was replacing the butter with 1 tbsp of olive oil. Thanks for sharing this recipe!!!
Bland. No one in my house would eat them.
The best recipe I have ever tried...this is a must

Loved this recipe, I had never tried roasted pumpkin seeds before. Everyone that tried them loved them. Great flavor, not overpowering. I didn't change the recipe, nor would I. Loved them right out of the oven and the next day as well.
These have turned out excellent each time I have made them. I have scaled it up to make more than 2 cups. It just requires a little more time in the oven.

Delicious! I followed the brining advice and I do think it enhanced the flavor. Brought the seed to a boil in very salty water, turned off and let sit for 15 min before draining.
Thanks!
Fabulous! We make these every year since I found the recipe! Too easy!
Simple and delicious! I can see that it might be a bit salty for some but the saltiness was part of why we thought this recipe was so good.

A pretty great, basic recipe. I always toast my leftover pumpkin seeds when I carve my jack o lantern. I tweaked this to my tastes. Instead of season salt and Worcestershire, I used butter, cinnamon, and sugar to give them a sweet flavor! So delicious, even my husband who was skeptical of eating pumpkin seeds loved them.
Would not have expected this to be soooo good. Was awesome I made more!
They were a hit with everyone that tried them! I even had a few people call me later asking for the recipe. We will definitely incorporate these in our halloween tradition.
This is a great alternative treat to the plainer recipe I usually go with. They're rich and buttery. Everyone in my family and at work adores them!
Different kind of flavor from the Worchestershire Sauce. Really liked it.

Delicious! Boiling them for about 10 minutes before baking makes them even crunchier! This is my go to recipe now--it's a keeper. Edit: I followed the recipe using some spaghetti squash seeds, and my 3 year old tried to eat the entire container of seeds!
